Column1: Stoinis to Kuldeep Yadav, out Bowled! There we go! Finds the blockhole, and uproots the middle-stump as Kuldeep tries slugging it away into the cow corner region. That's the end of it, and Australia, man-o-man, down 0-2, and they've come from behind to win 3-2. Fantastic scenes, and the Aussies are chuffed! Kuldeep Yadav b Stoinis 8(12) [4s-1]
Stoinis to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, short ball, at the body, Kuldeep Yadav is advancing but notices the length and is forced to duck! Bounces over his head...
Stoinis to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, fuller length delivery angled wide outside off, Kuldeep Yadav stays leg-side and laces it towards the covers but doesn't take the single
Stoinis to Bumrah, 1 run, short one, Bumrah tries hooking, gets a spliced top-edge on it just over the circle for a single
Stoinis to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, shortish one again, Kuldeep Yadav clubs it away into the gap at deep midwicket again, but Handscomb comes around from a squarer position to pick it up
Stoinis to Kuldeep Yadav, wide, angled past the tramline from over the wicket and that's called a wide by the umpire
Stoinis to Kuldeep Yadav, FOUR, shortish delivery, Kuldeep Yadav backs away and clubs it away with a pseudo-pull towards the cow corner fence for four
J Richardson to Bumrah, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, Bumrah tries to push it towards cover, gets a thick inside edge towards fine leg, and Kuldeep denies him the single!
J Richardson to Bumrah, no run, another short one, well-directed ball, Bumrah tries pulling again, but is hurried by the pace. Ducks again...
J Richardson to Bumrah, no run, bumper at the No.11 @137km/h, Bumrah jack-knifes after shaping up to play a shot, hits something and lobs up, but lands well in front of the 'keeper

J Richardson to Shami, out Caught&Bowled! Hammered into the pitch, just outside off, Shami clears his front-leg again to launch into that pull he's been trying throughout his brief knock, gets it off the splice, up in the air, not too high, and J Richardson rushes forward, aided by the momentum from his followthrough towards the dipping ball to take a return catch. Just one wicket away from glory, are Australia. Shami c and b J Richardson 3(7)
J Richardson to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, short of length delivery on the body, Kuldeep Yadav backs away and pulls it away towards wide mid-on for a single
J Richardson to Shami, 1 run, shortish one, Shami indulges in a short-arm pull towards the cow corner region for a single
Pat Cummins to Shami, 1 run, finally connects with the pull, gets it away towards backward square leg for a single
Pat Cummins to Shami, no run, another short one, that Wagner length, Shami tries hooking it once again, and it whizzes past his face
Pat Cummins to Shami, no run, shortish delivery, doesn't rise much, Shami backs away and tries to cart it over cow corner, misses it completely. Not enough bounce for that shot...
Pat Cummins to Shami, no run, short and wide, Shami tries to slap it through the cover, but he's early on it and ends up miscuing it towards mid-on
Pat Cummins to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, strays on the pads, whipped away to deep square leg for a single

Pat Cummins to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Kuldeep Yadav opens the face towards short third man - he takes off for the single, and there's a sharp throw at the striker's end. Might have been out, if he had hit!
J Richardson to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, back of a length delivery on the leg-stump, tucked in front of square leg for a single. They think about the double but finally decide against it - rightly so
J Richardson to Shami, 1 run, short ball, Shami swivels into a hook to backward square leg for a single. Lands short of the man in the deep
J Richardson to Kuldeep Yadav, leg byes, 1 run, short of length delivery on the hip, tucked away off the body towards fine leg for a single
J Richardson to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, short of length delivery just outside off, Kuldeep Yadav tries running it down to the third man region, and misses
J Richardson to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, short ball, Kuldeep Yadav ducks underneath it

J Richardson to Kedar Jadhav, out Caught by Maxwell! Well, that looks like the night for India. Australia have virtually sealed it, and it shows in the celebration of the Aussies. A short one at the body, Kedar Jadhav is hurried onto the backfoot, plays the lofted pull and tries to clear the cow corner fence, but Maxwell comes around from deep midwicket position to grab the catch and breaks into a celebratory run. That may have been the idea - the squarer boundaries are rather long and that's why the short ball tactic. Nevertheless, a valiant effort by Jadhav comes to an end. Kedar Jadhav c Maxwell b J Richardson 44(57) [4s-4 6s-1]

Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, out Caught by Finch! Australia get the breakthrough! Boy, they were getting nervous. A fantastic innings by Bhuvi comes to an end. A cross-seamer that grips a little, on a fuller length, Bhuvneshwar backs away into the on-side and tries chipping it towards long-off, as Aaron Finch at mid-off backpedals to settle under it. Australia heave a sigh of relief and a fantastic partnership is broken. Bhuvneshwar c Finch b Pat Cummins 46(54) [4s-3 6s-2]
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, no run, fuller length delivery on middle, nudged towards mid-on, and they decide against the run
Pat Cummins to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, short ball, Kedar Jadhav advances forward and across, mistimes a swivel-pull towards backward square leg for a single
Pat Cummins to Kedar Jadhav, 2 runs, yorker length delivery speared in towards middle, Kedar Jadhav drags his foot back towards leg and whips it away towards deep mid-wicket for a couple
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, short of length delivery rising slowly towards the chest, Bhuvneshwar hops and taps it on the head towards point for a quick single
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, wide, far too wide outside off, beyond the tramline, and that's called a wide
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, FOUR, angling in towards middle, Bhuvneshwar backs away and steers it away late, almost behind him, towards the fine third man fence for four

J Richardson to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, short of length delivery just outside off, tapped on the head into the off-side, doesn't go too far, Jadhav was almost sold down the river at the striker's end, but he makes it in the end as the he races the bowler to the striker's end. The bowler misses the under-arm throw at the stumps too
J Richardson to Kedar Jadhav, leg byes, 1 run, short of length delivery on the hip, Kedar Jadhav misses the glance, lobs off the hip into the on-side and they scurry across for a sharp single
J Richardson to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, shortish and on off, Kumar makes room and pats it to point
J Richardson to Bhuvneshwar, no run, dropped! Tough chance though. Kumar wanted to flat-bat this and miscued it back at Richardson who couldn't cling on. Harsh to call it a chance

J Richardson to Bhuvneshwar, SIX, spanking shot from Kumar! He seems to have suddenly upped his powerhitting in this game, hasn't he? Was a length ball and he just cleared his front leg to slam this straight down the ground. Into the sight-screen for a maximum
J Richardson to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, dug in short on leg stump, swivel-pulled down to fine leg
Pat Cummins to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, short of length ddl angling in on the hip, tucked away towards backward square leg for a single
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, back of a length delivery skids through on middle and leg, tucked off the backfoot towards mid-wicket for a single
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, no run, oh he's given that the full monty and missed! A short of length delivery just outside off, Bhuvneshwar backs away and tries flat-batting that over long-off, misses
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, no run, fuller length delivery on the pads, nudged off the frontfoot towards mid-on

Pat Cummins to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, short of length delivery with no width, Kedar Jadhav lets it come on to the bat and steers it fine towards third man for a single as the squarer third man comes around swiftly to cut it off
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, short of length delivery without much width, tapped on the head off the backfoot towards deep extra cover for a single
Zampa to Kedar Jadhav, no run, tossed up just outside off, Kedar Jadhav gets forward and pushes it towards wide mid-off
Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, skids through towards leg, tapped on the head off the backfoot to long-on for a single

Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, SIX, what a shot! Keeps going in with the angle, flat and slow in pace, Bhuvneshwar backs away, clears his leg and opens up his stance to slog-sweep it over deep mid-wicket for six
Zampa to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, low full-toss on the pads, whipped away towards deep mid-wicket for a single
Zampa to Kedar Jadhav, no run, leg-break on a good length delivery outside off, Kedar Jadhav gets forward to defend, and it rips past the outside edge
Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, loopy half-volley, Bhuvneshwar clears his leg and drills it back to the bowler - dribbles through his fingers for a single straight down the ground
Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, no run, a tad short but skiddy, Kedar Jadhav gets on the backfoot and taps it on the head towards mid-on
Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, no run, flatter delivery fired in on off, Kedar Jadhav gets forward and stonewalls
Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, 2 runs, skids through on the pads, Kedar Jadhav gets quickly onto the backfoot and tucks it away towards cow corner for a couple

Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, a bit of flight on offer, on middle-stump, Kedar Jadhav gets his frontfoot across and swipes across the line, slog-sweeping it over the deep mid-wicket boundary for six. A huge roar, and Delhi has come alive...
Maxwell to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, skiddy and zipping towards off, a cramped cut off the under-edge to deep backward point for a single
Maxwell to Bhuvneshwar, no run, skids through from a good length towards leg, Bhuvneshwar tucks it towards midwicket
Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, skids through on middle, whipped away off the backfoot for a single
Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, no run, short but skiddy, Bhuvneshwar gets on the backfoot and tries pulling it away, gets a thick under-edge onto his boot into the off-side
Zampa to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, flatter and almost yorker length on leg and middle, dug out towards mid-wicket for a single
Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Bhuvneshwar backs away and slaps it away towards sweeper cover for a single
Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, no run, tossed up on a length on middle, Bhuvneshwar gets forward and nudges it towards mid-on
Zampa to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, shortish and angling towards leg-stump, Kedar Jadhav gets low and on his knee to pull it away to backward square leg for a single
Maxwell to Bhuvneshwar, FOUR, full and wide, Bhuvi throws his bat on the drive and drills it in the gap through point. Useful runs these for India
Maxwell to Bhuvneshwar, no run, dabbed away to short third man

Maxwell to Bhuvneshwar, no run, whoopsy! Ther's a WWE moment here, not intentional by any means. Driven to the right of Maxwell and he crashed straight into Kedar Jadhav's tummy causing a comic tumble onto the ground. Maxi puts his hand up instantly and offers Jadhav a helping hand. All in good spirit
Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, loopy and dips on leg-stump, Jadhav manoeuvres it off the toe-end towards short fine
Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, no run, fullish just outside off, Jadhav turns it into the leg-side with soft hands

Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, Jadhav is not letting Maxwell go scot-free. Picks the quicker delivery early, jumps down the pitch in a flash and smashes it past mid-off with plenty of bottom hand power
J Richardson to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, 134ks slipping into the pads, Jadhav gets inside the line and clips it square on the on-side
J Richardson to Kedar Jadhav, no run, length ball angling in towards off, Jadhav shows a straight bat in defence
J Richardson to Kedar Jadhav, leg byes, FOUR, that's a gimme on the pads and Jadhav was slightly late in bringing his bat across, it clips the pad and runs away fine past the keeper
J Richardson to Kedar Jadhav, no run, 136ks good length on off, Jadhav blunts it down off the front foot
J Richardson to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, the lifter outside off stump, Bhuvi leapt high and managed some glove on the defence into the off-side, Kedar Jadhav calls him through for a quick single
J Richardson to Bhuvneshwar, no run, full on leg-stump, Bhuvi tucks it to short mid-wicket
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, no run, drifting in on middle and leg, worked away off the pads to square leg
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, no run, slower and sharp spin outside off, Jadhav seeks to cut and is beaten on the outside edge

Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, no run, dips cunningly on a fullish length and Jadhav's almost handed a catch to mid-off. It falls just short of Finch to his right, Jadhav went hard on the biff and didn't get the timing right
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, no run, advances and blocks the flatter delivery down the pitch
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, no run, flighted full outside off, Jadhav lunges forward and blocks into the off-side
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, no run, turns in on middle and leg, Jadhav flicks it straight to square leg
J Richardson to Bhuvneshwar, no run, short at the body, Bhuvi leaps inside the crease and drops it off his wrists onto his thigh pad
J Richardson to Bhuvneshwar, no run, 132ks length on fifth stump, Bhuvi splices the drive into the leg-side
J Richardson to Bhuvneshwar, no run, unveils the bumper on the stumps, Bhuvi arches back looking to ramp but no dice. Beaten for extra bounce
J Richardson to Bhuvneshwar, no run, 133ks full outside off, Bhuvi looks to force a drive through the off-side but ends up misitiming it off the cue end to mid-on
J Richardson to Bhuvneshwar, 2 runs, 133ks again, Bhvui gets on his tippy toes and creams the punch in the gap wide of extra cover for a couple of runs
J Richardson to Bhuvneshwar, no run, 133ks full and attacking off-stump, Bhuvi plays it back to the bowler
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, no run, skiddy offbreak on the stumps, Jadhav looks to push it wide of cover, but mistimes it off the outside half towards point
Lyon to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, goes deep inside the crease and biffs the punch to long-on
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, 85ks, floated up outside off, Jadhav opens the face and punches it through point
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, wide, quick slider, drifts down leg with the arm. Carey knocks the bails of and asks the square leg umpire to go upstairs, but Jadhav's back foot never went up. Well in...
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, no run, appeal for lbw, but the impact is well outside off as Jadhav strode forward to push
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, no run, turning back in from outside off, Kedar Jadhav is on the backfoot to nudge it behind square leg
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, no run, tossed up on middle, Kedar Jadhav gets forward and deadbats
Pat Cummins to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, 139ks, zippy length delivery around off, Jadhav shuffles across and tucks it off his hip through square leg
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, 137ks asking to be driven outside off, Bhuvi obliges and plays it with an open bat face through point
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, no run, pounds it short at the body, Bhuvi steers it off his chest towards backward point
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, no run, good length outside off, Bhuvi taps it in front of backward point

Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, FOUR, edged and four! Full and seeking off-stump at 142ks, Bhuvi was late in bringing his bat down and hence, it snicks the outside edge and flies past the keeper to his right
Pat Cummins to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, 133ks length ball outside off stump, Jadhav tilts the bat face and scythes it through point for a single
Lyon to Bhuvneshwar, no run, full outside off, wristy work from Bhuvi as he places the drive to the left of short mid-wicket
Lyon to Bhuvneshwar, no run, spinning in from a length, punched to the right of the bowler
Lyon to Bhuvneshwar, no run, fuller and wider of off, Bhuvi rolls his wrists on the on-drive and hits it straight to short mid-wicket
Lyon to Bhuvneshwar, no run, strides across and blocks the flatter delivery into the leg-side
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, knocked away with the spin through square leg region
Lyon to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, dishes it full outside off, keeps a touch low too, Bhuvi uses his bottom hand power to whip it wide of long-on
Pat Cummins to Kedar Jadhav, no run, 137ks slightly short outside off, Jadhav punches crisply but he can't get it past a diving Maxwell at backward point
Pat Cummins to Kedar Jadhav, no run, 141ks full on off and middle, Jadhav pings the drive straight to the fielder at mid-off
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, fuller and angling in, Bhuvi drops it on the off-side and nabs a quick single
Pat Cummins to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, sits up at 137ks from back of a length, Jadhav jumps on the back foot and cuts it behind point for a single
Pat Cummins to Kedar Jadhav, no run, 129ks cross-seamer in the corridor of uncertainty, keeps Jadhav on the back foot and rips it past his outside edge
Pat Cummins to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, back of a length just outside off stump, at 132ks and thus Bhuvi uses the pace with an open face tap into the off-side
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, no run, offie drifting in towards middle, Jadhav smothers it into the leg-side
Lyon to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, 82ks flat outside off, Bhuvi opens the bat face and dabs it through cover-point
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, spinning into middle and leg, Jadhav clips it backwards of square leg for a single
Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, no run, forward and blocked into the leg-side

Lyon to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, short and wide of off, not too much room on offer but Jadhav went deep inside the crease and played it off the keeper's gloves before running it off the bat face through point
Lyon to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, offbreak from Lyon, Bhuvi camps back and punches it down to long-on
Zampa to Kedar Jadhav, no run, drifts in towards off from a length, Jadhav hangs back and punches it back to the bowler
Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, full on middle, Bhuvi knocks it away off the pads to mid-wicket
Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, no run, plays the late cut, beats the slip to his right but can't get it past short third man
Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, no run, looped up outside off, Bhuvi stays leg-side of the delivery and hits it straight to cover
Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, no run, tossed full on off, Bhuvi drives it to mid-off
Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, no run, quicker googly on middle, Bhuvi picks it early and plonks his bat in front of pad
Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, no run, floated up outside off, Jadhav strides forward and smothers it into the off-side
Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, no run, tossed up and turning in, Jadhav hangs back and defends it down the wicket

Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, delicate! Something to cheer about for the crowd. Turning down leg and Jadhav just helps it along the way, used the pace of Maxwell and played it fine enough to pick up a boundary
Maxwell to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, drops it full on the pads and Bhuvneshwar nurdles it to backward square leg
Maxwell to Bhuvneshwar, no run, worked into the leg-side and there is confusion regarding the run, they don't take it in the end
Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, spinning into the pads, Jadhav tucks it to fine leg
Zampa to Bhuvneshwar, no run, double wicket maiden! Is he a contender for the Man of the Series? Tries a googly to the new batsman but lands it in the blockhole, Bhuvi squeezes it to cover

Zampa to Jadeja, out Stumped!! Wicket number 11 for Zampa in the series. Second in the over. Jadeja walks back without troubling the scores. He had a good day with the ball but fails to justify his role with the bat. The googly and Jadeja had no clue about it, he lunged forward to defend and is beaten by the away turn, fails to drag his foot back in and Carey is quick enough to catch him on the line. Jadeja st Carey b Zampa 0(3)
Zampa to Jadeja, no run, lands it full and Jadeja drives it back to the bowler
Zampa to Jadeja, no run, wrong 'un around off, Jadeja presses forward and defends back to Zampa

Zampa to Rohit, out Stumped!! Is that the game? Zampa should have had Rohit before but he won't mind it now. How good has he been in the series? 10th wicket for him. There was a sense that Rohit was getting frustrated with the dot balls and the missed scoring opportunities, he rushes down the wicket to play a big shot, but Zampa is not one who gives the ball air, the zip on the delivery beats the inside edge and Carey does the rest behind the sticks. What's worse is Rohit's bat slipped out of his hand and ended up near short fine as he completed the swing. Rohit st Carey b Zampa 56(89) [4s-4]
Zampa to Rohit, no run, drifts the leg-break in and Rohit settles into a forward block
Maxwell to Rohit, 1 run, spinning into the legs and Rohit nudges it backward of square leg
Maxwell to Rohit, no run, shimmies down and yorks himself, digs it back to Maxwell
Maxwell to Rohit, no run, slower and turning in, Rohit bends low and works it to mid-wicket
Maxwell to Rohit, no run, straying on the legs, Rohit misses the sweep and the ball deflects off the pad
Maxwell to Rohit, no run, comes down the track and pushes it back to Maxwell, who mocks a throw at Rohit
Maxwell to Rohit, no run, stays low and Rohit does well to bring his bat down, knocked to the right of Maxwell
Zampa to Kedar Jadhav, no run, Jadhav tries to emulate Rohit with a drop and run, but the fielders are close in for him as he is new to the crease
Zampa to Rohit, 1 run, tossed up around off, Rohit drops it into the off-side and rotates strike
Zampa to Rohit, no run, steps out and is done in by the length, he pushes at the ball and the inside edge rolls to short fine
Zampa to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, drifting in and Jadhav nurdles it round the corner - to square leg
Zampa to Rohit, 1 run, flatter delivery on off, Rohit brings his bat down and bunts it towards point

Zampa to Rohit, no run, dropped! Would you believe it? Zampa should have had Rohit twice in two balls. And more surprisingly it is Maxwell who puts it down. Flighted outside off, Rohit drives uppishly straight to extra cover, Maxwell bends down and spills it. There is no dew around, so not sure why the shoddy work from the Australians

Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, bad delivery and Jadhav does not miss out. Long hop outside off and the good thing is he didn't try to muscle it to the on-side, slapped it powerfully between extra cover and mid-off
Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, no run, spinning in and Jadhav misses the nudge, the ball pops up off the thigh pad
Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, no run, slower and turning in, Jadhav bunts it towards cover
Maxwell to Rohit, 1 run, full delivery and Rohit wrists it to long-on
Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, opens the bat face and dabs it to the vacant backward point region
Maxwell to Kedar Jadhav, no run, spinning into the right hander and Jadhav works it towards mid-wicket

Zampa to Rohit, no run, dropped! Tough chance but you expect the 'keeper to take those. Tossed up around off, Rohit is drawn into the forward defensive, the ball turns away to grazes the outside edge and Carey is slow to react, the ball hits the glove before deflecting away. Zampa has his hands on his head. That would have been the match

Zampa to Rohit, 2 runs, risky second there. Low dipping full toss and Rohit opens the bat face to direct it behind point, called for two immediately and had to put in the dive to make his crease. Needless at this point

Zampa to Shankar, out Caught by Khawaja!! Six and out! He is distraught as he makes the walk back. Zampa is relieved. He runs towards Khawaja. The slider which is a bit short, Shankar went for the pull but Zampa gets it to skid after pitching, it hits the splice of the bat and skis up towards long-on. Khawaja covers good ground to his right and completes it with a slide. Shankar c Khawaja b Zampa 16(21) [6s-1]

Zampa to Shankar, SIX, needed that. Needed that big time. The run flow had been stopped and you could see the pressure on him. Flighted leg-break and Shankar went against the spin, but his long levers helped to clear long-on
Zampa to Shankar, no run, floated up and lands it in the blockhole, Shankar squeezes the drive towards Maxi at extra cover
Zampa to Shankar, no run, quick and on the stumps, Shankar punches it to mid-wicket
Maxwell to Rohit, no run, slower and turning in, Rohit bends down and turns it to square leg
Maxwell to Shankar, 1 run, lands it full enough for Shankar to drive down to mid-wicket

Maxwell to Rohit, 1 run, fifty for Rohit. The crowd are standing and cheering. Just a bat raise to acknowledge that and some glove love with Shankar. He remains the key for India's chase here. Opens the bat face and knocks it past cover
Maxwell to Shankar, 1 run, flighted on off and middle, Shankar drives to long-on
Maxwell to Shankar, no run, shortens the length and gets some turn, worked straight to square leg
Maxwell to Shankar, no run, tossed up on off-stump, Shankar drives it back to Maxwell
Zampa to Rohit, no run, flighted outside off, Rohit goes for the drive with hard hands and mistimes it to cover, sends Shankar back quickly
Zampa to Shankar, leg byes, 1 run, sliding in and Shankar misses the flick, the ball deflects off the pad into the leg-side
Zampa to Rohit, 1 run, wrong 'un and Rohit works it with the spin to square leg, easy single
Zampa to Shankar, 1 run, drifts in and Shankar drives past a diving Finch near mid-wicket, single to long-on
Zampa to Rohit, 1 run, once more uses his feet, takes it on the full and wrists the drive to long-on
Zampa to Rohit, no run, comes down the track, gets a bit too close to the ball, squeezes it to cover
Lyon to Shankar, no run, quicker and around off, Shankar punches it past Rohit, but Maxwell has been moved straighter at mid-wicket to stop that single
Lyon to Rohit, 1 run, waits in the crease and dabs it behind point, that gap needs to be plugged - third single in the over there
Lyon to Shankar, 1 run, closes the bat face to work it into the leg-side and the leading edge bobbles away to backward point
Lyon to Rohit, 1 run, 8000 ODI runs. Joint third fastest to reach the landmark. Not sure he realises that. No celebration from him. He gets with a dab towards the vacant backward point area
Lyon to Shankar, 1 run, 94.5ks on the flattish offie and Shankar punches it uppishly to long-on
Lyon to Shankar, no run, nudged with the spin towards square leg
Zampa to Rohit, no run, 92.2ks on the leg-break and Rohit runs it off the bat face, the ball rolls past his legs

Zampa to Rohit, 2 runs, flighted outside off, Rohit opens the bat face to drive it square on the off-side, the call was for two and the pair get it comfortably. A better throw might have had Rohit in trouble
Zampa to Rohit, no run, attacks the stumps and Rohit pushes it to the right of Zampa
Zampa to Shankar, 1 run, drifting in on the fullish length, Shankar eases the drive to long-on
Zampa to Rohit, 1 run, pushed through and Rohit drops it with soft hands into the off-side, calls for the quick single
Zampa to Shankar, 1 run, lots of air on this leg-break and Shankar drives it down to long-off
Lyon to Shankar, 1 run, bit of extra bounce that foils Shankar's attempted late cut, hits him on the glove and rolls past Carey
Lyon to Rohit, 1 run, fraction short and Rohit has ample time to punch it to sweeper cover
Lyon to Rohit, no run, quicker and breaking in, Rohit prods forward and turns it to mid-wicket
Lyon to Shankar, 1 run, moves across and punches the off-break with the spin to long-on
Lyon to Rohit, 1 run, runs down the wicket and looks to loft it with the spin, but Lyon kept it outside off and Rohit had to reach it, dragged it off the inner half to long-on, just a single
Lyon to Rohit, no run, flatter delivery and Rohit punches it softly towards cover
Zampa to Rohit, 1 run, drifting into the pads and Rohit picks it away backward of square leg
Zampa to Rohit, no run, quicker and on the shorter side, Rohit knocks it back to Zampa
Zampa to Rohit, no run, floated up outside off, Rohit is a bit casual in his push and almost offers a return catch to Zampa
Zampa to Shankar, 1 run, half tracker and Shankar picks out the lone fielder in the deep, pulled straight to deep square leg

Zampa to Shankar, no run, Carey appeals for a LBW. Nothing from Zampa. Pushed through around off, Shankar presses forward and blocks it off the middle of the bat. The sound was bat thudding into the pad
Zampa to Rohit, 1 run, flighted outside off and Rohit opens the bat face to ease it past cover
Lyon to Shankar, no run, tossed up outside off, Shankar shuffles and wrists it to mid-wicket

Lyon to Pant, out Caught by Turner!! Edged and taken! That's a dream delivery for an off-spinner. So Pant at number 4 does not work out. Lovely drift into the left hander, draws Pant on the forward defensive before the ball spins away, the outside edge pops up gently to Turner at slip. Australia are well ahead in the game now. Pant c Turner b Lyon 16(16) [4s-1 6s-1]
Lyon to Pant, no run, flighted around off, Pant stays back and bunts it in front of backward point
Lyon to Rohit, 1 run, this time the single is pinched. Rohit drops it with soft hands into the off-side and Pant is off on his bike, no hesitation and the duo complete it with ease
Lyon to Rohit, no run, spinning in from outside off and Rohit prods forward to defend into the leg-side
Lyon to Rohit, no run, worked with the spin to square leg and an eager Pant is sent back by Rohit
Zampa to Pant, no run, googly and Pant picked it alright, pushed it firmly with the spin to mid-off
Zampa to Rohit, 1 run, wrong 'un with a plenty of air and Rohit drills the drive back to Zampa, who is brave enough to get a hand and parry it to long-off
Zampa to Pant, 1 run, flatter in trajectory and Pant tucks it square on the leg-side, for a single
Zampa to Rohit, 1 run, gives it a bit of air and Rohit is happy to drive it down the ground to long-off
Zampa to Pant, 1 run, quicker and around off, Pant shuffles across and nurdles it round the corner - to backward square leg

Zampa to Pant, SIX, welcome to the attack, Mr. Zampa. A poor delivery to start ones spell. Real long hop and Pant does not need a second invitation, rocks back and smokes the pull into the crowd in the deep mid-wicket stand
Lyon to Rohit, no run, flatter and quicker, Rohit punches it back to Lyon
Lyon to Pant, 1 run, drops it fraction short and Pant cracks it square of the wicket, Zampa tidies up from sweeper
Lyon to Pant, no run, nice and slow from the offie, Pant presses forward and blocks it dead
Lyon to Pant, no run, tossed up around off, Pant prods forward and defends down the wicket
Lyon to Rohit, 1 run, treks back in the crease and opens the bat face to manoeuvre the ball wide of cover
Lyon to Rohit, no run, flighted off break outside off, defended off the front foot
Stoinis to Pant, no run, fuller and outside off, Pant reaches out to defend to short cover
Stoinis to Pant, no run, fuller and around off, blocked off the front foot towards Stoinis
Stoinis to Rohit, 1 run, angling in on middle and leg, Rohit works it away to deep square leg for a single
Stoinis to Pant, 1 run, on a length outside off, Pant leans forward and steers it down to third man
Stoinis to Pant, no run, back of a length outside off, rides the bounce with a tap to point
Stoinis to Pant, FOUR, flashes and flashes hard! Pant ain't gonna die wondering. Sees it short and wide, goes for a sliced cut and clears backward point with ease
Lyon to Rohit, no run, spins in from a good length, tucked off the back foot to mid-wicket
Lyon to Rohit, no run, drifting in from outside off, defended from the crease to cover
Lyon to Pant, 1 run, slightly short and cut away towards deep point for a single
Lyon to Rohit, 1 run, quicker and shorter this time, punched off the back foot towards long-on
Lyon to Rohit, no run, stifled LBW shout! Ripping off break and struck Rohit on the front pad but the stride he got forward ensured that he was just outside the line, marginally
Lyon to Rohit, no run, flatter and around off, Rohit stays back and blocks it out
Stoinis to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Rohit steers it away down to third man for a single
Stoinis to Rohit, no run, on a length outside off, defended from the crease towards cover
Stoinis to Pant, 1 run, middle and off line and Pant works it towards square leg for a single

Stoinis to Kohli, out Caught by Carey!! Massive strike from Stoinis! How much of an impact will this have? The Aussies are certainly pumped and they believe that they have a hand on the trophy already. Wasn't a dangerous delivery at all, cross-seamer on a shortish length and Kohli went hard on the cut. Only to get a faint feather through to Carey who took it with ease. Must say that it was an unusual shot from Kohli who is generally quite composed in run chases. Kohli c Carey b Stoinis 20(22) [4s-2]
Stoinis to Rohit, 1 run, shortish around off stump, wristed away through square leg for a single
Stoinis to Kohli, 1 run, angling into the pads and Kohli nonchalantly clips it away down to fine leg
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run, the slider on leg stump, Kohli hangs back and tucks it down towards fine leg
Lyon to Rohit, 1 run, darted in on leg stump, Rohit works it away to deep mid-wicket. 50-run stand! Important one for India and these two know that the job isn't even half done
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run, flighted fuller on middle and leg, Kohli worked away towards long-on
Lyon to Rohit, 1 run, drifting away from around off, pushed towards the gap at point for a single
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run, sliding in on middle and off, worked off the back foot to deep mid-wicket
Lyon to Kohli, FOUR, deft touch from Kohli! Flatter one from Lyon, wasn't that wide but Kohli created it with a late cut. Got it fine enough to beat a diving Turner at short third man
Stoinis to Kohli, 1 run, shortish and outside off, Kohli steers it down to third man to retain strike
Stoinis to Kohli, no run, fuller and outside off, defended off the front foot to short cover who fumbles but no harm done
Stoinis to Rohit, 1 run, on a good length outside off, Rohit steers it down to third man for a single
Stoinis to Kohli, 1 run, straighter line this time and Kohli tucks it to mid-wicket

Stoinis to Rohit, 5 runs, sloppy from Australia! Maxi with a needless direct hit at the bowler's end and there was nobody backing up. Kept racing away to the fence. Was a gentle dab towards point by Rohit and it was an easy single really

Stoinis to Rohit, 5 wides, this kept really low! Not the first time that Rohit has been undone by the lack of bounce. Went for the pull across the line but this hardly rose and just missed leg stump and beat Carey to the fine leg fence. Wides given and the Aussies aren't pleased. I guess they have every right to, as this might have clipped the pad perhaps
Stoinis to Kohli, 1 run, slightly short and it's swivel-pulled down towards long leg
J Richardson to Rohit, no run, low full toss and Rohit drives this with sublime timing but straight to short cover

J Richardson to Rohit, FOUR, in the air but clears mid-on! Rohit saw the length a touch full and wanted to launch it straight back over the bowler's head but got it more of the inner half of the blade. Still had enough on it to clear a leaping Stoinis who wasn't at the edge of the circle. If he was, then he might have had a realistic chance of pouching this
J Richardson to Rohit, no run, pitched up with a hint of inward movement, Rohit doesn't lose his balance and drives with a straight bat to mid-off
J Richardson to Kohli, 1 run, shortish length outside off, Kohli glides it away down to third man
J Richardson to Kohli, no run, fuller length, enticing the drive and Kohli checks the shot towards cover. It's a heavily packed off-side field, all of them looking for that aerial drive
J Richardson to Kohli, no run, fuller and around off stump, Kohli shuffles across and defends towards mid-on
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, fuller and outside off, Rohit mistimes the drive towards mid-off. First maiden of the match!
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, the hard length around off stump, tucked softly towards the mid-wicket fielder

Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, rash from Rohit! Saw the length a trifle short and wanted to launch into the front foot pull. The Kotla surface doesn't have much of bounce for this stroke and it sneaks slightly under the bat
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, on a length outside off, push-driven on the up towards the fielder at cover

Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, wanted to dab this down to third man but ended up getting a bottom edge towards the gully region and backward point attacked the ball to prevent the single. Rohit did want the run but Kohli smartly sent his partner back
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, back of a length, angling into the hips and is tucked towards mid-wicket
J Richardson to Kohli, no run, back of a length, angling in a bit and takes the inside half of the blade as Kohli tries to defend. Trickles to short mid-wicket
J Richardson to Kohli, no run, fuller in length and outside off, Kohli check-drives this towards mid-off
J Richardson to Kohli, no run, shortish and outside off, rises a bit but Kohli has it covered. Defended back to Richardson
J Richardson to Rohit, 1 run, fifth stump line from a good length, Rohit opens the bat face to run this down to third man
J Richardson to Rohit, FOUR, nails it this time! Classy from Rohit, stood tall to this good length ball and pierced the gap at cover with his back foot punch. Exquisitely timed and it just sped away
J Richardson to Rohit, no run, short of a good length and Rohit wanted to essay the back foot punch of his. Ends up mistiming it towards the short cover region

Pat Cummins to Rohit, 1 run, slanting in from a shortish length, Rohit hangs back and works it through the gap at mid-wicket. They thought of the second but the man from deep square leg got across quickly
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, the hard length, pacy as well and Rohit dabs it off the back foot towards cover

Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, this one kicked up! Took Rohit totally by surprise and rapped him on the glove. Was on the shorter side and kept climbing into Rohit who ended up fending with one hand off the bat eventually
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, angling in from a good length, Rohit gets behind the line well and blocks to cover
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, back of a length this time, around off stump and Rohit taps this towards point
Pat Cummins to Kohli, 1 run, shortish and just outside off, steered with an open face down to third man

J Richardson to Kohli, 1 run, had to hurry! Kohli was taking a definite risk here and fortunately for him, Stoinis' throw doesn't hit the target at the bowler's end. Was a near yorker that was squeezed towards mid-on and the Indian captain fancied a single. Could have had himself in trouble. Replays show that he would have made it, just but why take such a risk so early?
J Richardson to Rohit, 1 run, not much room on offer this time and Rohit manages to dab it down to third man

J Richardson to Rohit, FOUR, beautifully struck! Not the traditional cover drive from Rohit but he leant nicely onto this drive and opened the face late to get it through the gap between extra cover and mid-off. The outfield is going to give you full value for shots, as we've seen all day
J Richardson to Rohit, no run, slightly shortish and Rohit punches this onto the ground and it goes towards point. Can't thread the gap
J Richardson to Rohit, no run, closer to the off pole, Rohit stands tall and defends towards the cover region
J Richardson to Kohli, 1 run, short of a length outside off, steered from the crease down to third man

Pat Cummins to Rohit, FOUR, not exactly in control but will get a boundary. There was a hint of width on offer and Rohit went for the square drive on the up. Got it more of the slice but beat gully comfortably and third man had no chance of getting across as this just kept racing away

Pat Cummins to Kohli, 1 run, nearly a run out! Rohit responded late to the run and had Cummins in the way as the pacer tried to kick the ball onto the stumps at the keeper's end. Might have been close if it had hit. Was a faint inside edge onto the thigh pad from Kohli and they thought of taking the run
Pat Cummins to Kohli, FOUR, the typical Kohli stroke! Wide half volley, he just leans into the drive and eased it through the gap at cover. Nobody moved. Shot of a man who is on top of the world
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, Cummins is working up some steam here, pacy good length ball and strikes close to the bat splice as Kohli leans forward to defend

Pat Cummins to Dhawan, out Caught by Carey!! Cummins draws first blood! Dhawan didn't really wait for the umpire's decision as he knew he had got a nick. Was the away angler from a good length, a hint of movement as the southpaw went for the drive on the up. Only managed a thin feather through to Carey and the Australians immediately knew that they had got their man. Just the start the visitors were looking for. Dhawan c Carey b Pat Cummins 12(15) [4s-2]
Pat Cummins to Dhawan, no run, stump to stump line, on a good length and Dhawan nudges it towards Cummins
J Richardson to Dhawan, 1 run, angling in from around off, Dhawan defends it towards extra cover for a quick single
J Richardson to Dhawan, no run, angling in from around off stump, no room and Dhawan can only pat it back to Richardson
J Richardson to Rohit, 1 run, slightly shorter this time and Rohit wanted to punch this on the up, goes off the outside edge down to third man
J Richardson to Rohit, no run, on that length around the fourth stump channel, defended with a straight bat to mid-off
J Richardson to Dhawan, 1 run, full and angling into the pads, whipped away to deep square leg
J Richardson to Dhawan, no run, on a length outside off, punched from the crease towards point
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, fuller and outside off, good extended forward defence towards mid-off
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, nipbacker that cuts in sharply to ping Rohit high on the pad. A faint inside edge as well
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, angling in on middle and leg, worked gently towards mid-wicket
Pat Cummins to Dhawan, 1 run, leg stumpish this time and tucked behind square through leg-side
Pat Cummins to Dhawan, no run, closer to off stump on a good length, defended from the crease towards point
Pat Cummins to Dhawan, no run, slash and a miss! Was shortish and angling across Dhawan from well outside off. He wanted to cut it away but got beaten by the extra bounce off the deck
J Richardson to Rohit, no run, angled into Rohit from around off stump, gets right behind the line and blocks it
J Richardson to Dhawan, 1 run, round the wicket and angling into Dhawan, a bit too straight in line and clipped through backward square leg

J Richardson to Dhawan, FOUR, uppish but in the gap! Width on offer and Dhawan went for the drive on the up. Timed it well and threaded the stacked off-side field in the ring. Seems to be carrying over the form from Mohali
J Richardson to Dhawan, FOUR, erratic stuff and Dhawan puts it away. Was fed on the pads, he just shuffled a tad and clipped this inswinger through backward square leg
J Richardson to Dhawan, no run, width on offer, Dhawan goes for the flashy cut but only manages to chop it towards cover
J Richardson to Rohit, 1 run, quick single, Rohit nudges the in-angler in front of square leg and Dhawan comes across quickly
Pat Cummins to Dhawan, no run, fractionally short and angling across, punched off the back foot towards cover
Pat Cummins to Dhawan, no run, fullish length, Dhawan toe-ends the drive towards mid-off

Pat Cummins to Rohit, 1 run, fuller and outside off, Rohit leans into the drive and gets it wide of mid-off. Finch stationed there got across with a slide and hauled the ball back quickly to prevent the second
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, fuller and outside off, defended solidly off the front foot to cover
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, straighter lines again, angling into Rohit who defends with a slight shuffle across
Pat Cummins to Rohit, no run, angling in on middle and leg, Rohit gets across and defends it well
